message.content: Read the file at /Users/user/project/test-file.txt and add a new section at the end with content added by a Task agent. Add something like "--- Added by Task Agent ---" followed by a few lines of content to make it clear this was added by a subagent.

content.text: I'll read the file first and then add a section indicating it was added by a Task agent.

content.content:
1→This is a test file created by Claude.
     2→
     3→Hello from the conversation!
     4→
     5→Here is some additional content:
     6→- Item one
     7→- Item two
     8→- Item three
     9→
    10→This file was edited during our test session.
    11→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text:
Perfect, Okarin! I've successfully added a new section to the file at `/Users/user/project/test-file.txt`. 

The new section includes:
- A clear separator: "--- Added by Task Agent ---"
- Multiple lines of content explaining that this was added by a Task agent
- A timestamp (2025-12-20)
- A status indicator showing the operation completed successfully

The file now has this additional content at the end, making it clear that a subagent/Task agent made these modifications.
